title: What Are JDAMs? And What Will They Do For Ukraine?
description: The United States is giving satellite-guided bombs to Kyiv for the first time as part of a new $1.85 billion military aid package.

title: Ukraine’s spy chief says the threat of invasion from Belarus is low.
Threat of Invasion From Belarus Low, Says Ukraine Spy Chief
description: In a wide-ranging interview on the state of the war, Kyrylo Budanov also spoke about Russia-Iran relations and Moscow’s obsession with taking the city of Bakhmut.

title: Russian Forces Shell Ukraine’s Kherson Region
description: At least five civilians were killed and 18 injured in Russian attacks on Thursday and into Friday morning, an official said.

title: What Is a ‘Bomb Cyclone’?
description: These storms aren’t tremendously rare, but this particular one is much more powerful than most.

title: As Hope Fades for Missing Thai Sailors, Ship’s Safety Is Scrutinized
description: Four days after the warship sank, 23 men remain missing. The authorities said the warship did not have enough life jackets.

title: Gunman in Paris Opens Fire, Killing at Least 2
description: The shooting took place on a narrow street in the French capital, and a man has been taken into custody. The motive for the attack was not immediately clear.

title: Zelensky Returns to Ukraine After Visiting U.S. and Poland
description: “I am in my office,” the Ukrainian leader said in a video message after a whirlwind trip that was his first travel outside the country since the war began.

title: A Brutal Storm
description: Just before Christmas, a combination of ice, snow and winds is paralyzing much of the U.S.

title: Tracking North Korea’s Record Number of Missile Launches
description: Kim Jong-un’s regime has launched more than 90 ballistic and other missiles in 2022 — more than in any previous year — in defiance of United Nations resolutions.

title: Iran condemns Zelensky’s remarks to Congress as ‘baseless.’
As Cases Spread, China’s Low Covid Death Toll Convinces No One
description: China’s murky statistics are fueling widespread public distrust. Its narrow definition of Covid deaths “will very much underestimate the true death toll,” the W.H.O. says.

title: At German Christmas Markets, Smiles Shine Bright but Budgets Are Tight
description: In Nuremberg, the stalls are open without Covid restrictions, and big crowds are returning to sip mulled wine and socialize. But amid economic uncertainty, visitors are spending less.

title: His Job Description? Protecting German Democracy. Literally.
description: Thomas Haldenwang runs Germany’s Office for the Protection of the Constitution. His mission is to fight the enemies of German democracy — from far-right coup plotters to Russian hackers.

title: How to Travel the World While Putting Nature First
description: In the wake of the U.N. biodiversity conference, Julia Simpson, the head of the World Travel and Tourism Council, discusses a new initiative called nature positive travel.

title: Putin says giving Patriot missiles to Kyiv ‘is simply prolonging the conflict.’
The Senate passes a spending bill that includes nearly $50 billion in aid for Ukraine.
Your Friday Briefing
Day 23: On Christmas Day, No Rest for the Weary. (Or the Guy Who Feeds the Penguins.)
description: For a biologist in San Francisco, Dec. 25 will bring not presents and mistletoe, but beak trims and fish guts.

title: Congress Votes to Expand U.S. Power to Prosecute International War Crimes
description: Passed after an address by Ukraine’s leader, the bill would allow foreigners in the United States who are suspected of war crimes to be tried even if the crime was overseas and the victim was not American.
